publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-6591.1# Bill Kidd: Independent Living in Scotland Magazine, Rights Here Rights Now—As an amendment to motion (S3M-6591) in the name of Johann Lamont, insert at end ", but considers with regret that the previous UK administration led by Labour set back the interests of the independent living movement by its proposed changes to the Independent Living Fund (ILF) criteria that would restrict new applications to those disabled people who are in paid employment of 16 hours or more and that this could massively reduce the number of new people eligible for the ILF, which assists disabled people to access essential support."
